alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Cumberland; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 4:24AM EST until January 10 at 7:45PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia... Appomattox River Above Farmville affecting Prince Edward, Amelia and Cumberland Counties. For the Appomattox Basin...including Farmville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Appomattox River above Farmville. * WHEN...From early this morning to this evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, River Rd downstream of the gage near the railroad bridge begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:05 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 17.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:05 AM EST Wednesday was 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.3 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.1 feet on 12/25/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 430 PM EST.
